text: Eric "Fritzy" Freeman (13 July 1944 â€“ 14 December 2020) was an Australian cricketer. He played in 11 Tests from 1968 to 1970. He was also a leading Australian rules footballer with Port Adelaide Football Club, playing 116 games between 1964 and 1972.Vale Eric Freeman, David Jenkins, South Australian National Football League, 15 December 2020 Freeman was born in Semaphore, South Australia. Freeman died on 14 December 2020 from a heart attack at the age of 76.Former Australian Test cricketer and SANFL footballer Eric 'Fritzy' Freeman dies aged 76 ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Australian cricketers Category:Sportspeople from South Australia
title: Eric Freeman (cricketer)
